verses.roman:
eta cinti prātaḥ-kāle gaṅgā-snāna kari'
'nīlācale yāba' bali' calilā gaurahari

synonyms: eta cinti—thus thinking; prātaḥ-kāle—in the morning; gaṅgā-snāna—bathing in the Ganges; kari'-performing; nīlācale yāba—I shall go to Nīlācala (Jagannātha Purī); bali'-saying; calilā—started; gaurahari—Śrī Caitanya Mahāprabhu.
translation: Thinking like this, the Lord took His morning bath in the Ganges and started for Nīlācala, saying "I shall go there."
